item.description:
Its that time again.  Our bikes have been sitting in the garage collecting dust all winter and need some love.  Our skills also need some attention.  We need to re-focus from "Soccer Mom" mode, and back into sportbike mode.  This will also include some great skills training.  We may need to have a Part II, only because there is so much information to put out, and I do not want to bore everyone with too long of a lecture all at once.

Portsmouth RI meetup location:  Dunkin Donuts 1550 West Main Road, Portsmouth RI  02871

Boston area meetup location:  South Bay Center, 8 Allstate Rd, Boston, MA

There will be two meetup locations, one in Boston for those close to Tier 1 Sportbike riders, and the 2nd in Portsmouth for those closer to RI.  The actual training grounds will be at a point halfway between Portsmouth, RI and Boston, MA to make it equal for all.

Training Site:  Raynham Park (Raynham Dog Track), 1958 Broadway, Raynham MA  02767  This is the confirmed training site.  We have permission to use the North End of the parking lot next to the gas station.  Waivers will be signed by everyone participating and submitted to the Manager of the track, who will meet us at the start of the event.  I ask we all give a small donation in appreciation of the generosity of the Manager, and as a small gesture of our thanks for allowing us to use a safe space to conduct our training.  $5-10 or anything you can give.  The plan is to be able to use this space again in the future.

Note: you may also meet us at the Training Site at about 9:45

 We will go over some of the following in Part I:

  • Braking
  • Cornering (Riding the twisties, choosing your line, apex, corner speed, braking, throttle control, attention, body positioning)
  • Counter-Steering
  • Throttle control (including Throttle rule#1)
  • 40/60 rule, 75% rule
  • Survival Reactions and Survival Reaction Triggers

and a quick discussion of the following depending on time:

  • Bike Maintenance
  • Group Riding/Hand Signals
  • Road Hazards

Please do not feel you are above a refresh of your basic skills, or increase your knowledge. Take a few hours of your day to get the rust off, put your egos aside, and re-sharpen your skills from the previous season.  We want everyone ride safe, and learn some of the basics that catch us all off guard at times, while keeping risk at a minimum.

I am guesstimating 5-6hrs from start to finish, mixing the discussion in with some riding.  After practice, we will ride down State Route 28(scenic) to Cup 2 Cafe on 3175 Cranberry Highway, East Wareham MA  02538 for some coffee/lunch, then continuing on to State Route 3A(sweepers) to refine the skills we have learned, stopping near Quincy by the 93, and coordinate those going south to RI, and those north to Boston area.

Google Route Map

If we have a photographer in the group (or photographer in training), or just someone with a decent camera that can make it to take some pics of us all in action, that would be sweet.

I hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Orange/Black CBR600RR - Kickstands up at 9am, please be early, fueled up, and ready to go.
item.why: We can always increase our skills.
item.name: Skills Sharpening Part I (This is a joint meetup with Boston Tier 1 Riders)
